intro: Eleocharis cubensis, commonly known as the Cuban sedge, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of Cuba. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, forming dense clusters of narrow, grass-like leaves. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are arranged in spikelets, a common feature among sedges. Eleocharis cubensis plays a role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
